​
**Pushing U**

**25 crates (25 followers special)**
Discussed here: https://discord.com/channels/473538592896188446/473539236109221897/989816815939096596

> A puzzle game with, as the title says, 25 crates that all needs to be on a target. Each crate is completly unique by how it works. For example, a crate that you can push and pull, but only at two certain directions, and another one that leaves a trail that the crate can go on, but not the others.

itch.io: https://stingby12.itch.io/25-crates

​
**Meet me at NooN**
Discussed here: https://discord.com/channels/473538592896188446/474018445680312340/988738502671859792

> Meet me at NooN is a cozy puzzle game with brain-scratching time-loop mechanics. Control two spirits that create time loops each day, learn their different behaviors, how they can interact with each other and how these interactions are interfering with their time loops.

Steam: https://store.steampowered.com/app/1880490/Meet_me_at_NooN/

jahndis said:
> Hi everyone! Long time lurker on this server, but I thought this group might be interested in my recent (re)release of Mixisms, a daily, creative, semi-social anagram puzzle where you compose sayings from a random set of letters and then vote on your favorites.
> It's completely free with no ads, and now no longer requires a traditional login, and I thought it would be a lot more fun with some more people playing! 😄 
> Anyway, here it is. Enjoy! <https://mixisms.jahndis.com/>

mixisms.jahndis.com: https://mixisms.jahndis.com/

Discussed here: https://discord.com/channels/473538592896188446/722960890525384804/979282567389913109

> Set each pair of edges to either red or blue. If a node has a number, then total number of nodes that its connected to must be equal to that number (including the numbered node itself). Exactly one edge must be set for each pair...not both...not neither.

If snakebird is too hard, try snakebird primer! https://store.steampowered.com/app/1014140/Snakebird_Primer/

The same kind of puzzles, just way easier. I don't think it actually does a very good job of priming you for snakebird, but it is still fun in its own right if you're down for some low stress puzzling

I'm sure this has been brought up in the past, but Snakebird is a really good puzzle game that's like a thinky version of the traditional arcade snake game where eating the dots grows your snake, but replace snake and dot with snakebird and fruit, add gravity, and allow player to move when they want to move. Plus it's much nicer to look at. It's on android, iOS, Windows, Linux, and Mac. https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.NoumenonGames.SnakeBird_Touch

For fans of puzzle hunt style puzzle-solving, this game's pop-up "race against the world" puzzles have been pretty great so far: https://solve63.com/ (Idea is, when enough players press "join", an event starts, and the first to complete the sequence of 5 or so puzzles get a spot on the leaderboard for posterity; only 63 such events will happen.) Available on iPhone as of this writing, Android coming soon.

Ah! I should have posted this here a *long* time ago! Back in 2019 I and a few friends made a game for one of that years' Ludum Dares called Cipher. Antimatiere (2011) is a 3D first person game with an infinite, grid-like world where you solve puzzles by moving textures. It was a student project. I wonder if it inspired Manifold Garden (2019)?
